contentrichtext.text: {{TOCright}} '''Mach''' may refer to: ==People== * [[Mach (surname)]] * "Mach", nickname of [[Hayato Sakurai]] (born 1975), a mixed martial artist * a transliteration of [[Mai (Chinese surname)]] ==Science and technology== * [[Mach number]], a measure of speed based on the speed of sound * [[Muscarinic acetylcholine receptor]], abbreviated mACh ==Places== * [[Machh]] or Mach, a town in Pakistan * [[Machynlleth]], sometimes referred to colloquially as Mach, a market town in Wales * [[Mach (crater)]], a lunar crater * [[3949 Mach]], an asteroid ==Computers== * [[ATI Mach]], a 2D GPU chip by ATI * [[Mach-II]], an object-oriented MVC framework for CFML and PHP * [[Mach (kernel)]], an operating systems kernel technology * [[GNU Mach]], the microkernel upon which GNU Hurd is based * mach, a computer program for building [[RPM Package Manager|RPM packages]] in a chroot environment ==Entertainment== * ''[[M.A.C.H.]]'', a flight combat video game for the PlayStation Portable * [[Mach (Transformers)]], a fictional character * [[Mach (Rainbow song)|"Mach" (Rainbow song)]], released by the South Korean girl group Rainbow in 2010 ==See also== * [[Shock diamond]], also known as Mach disk, diamond pattern seen in rocket exhaust * [[Mach bands]], an optical illusion * [[Mach's principle]] * [[Mach angle]] * [[Mach wave]] * [[Mach reflection]] * [[Mach effect (disambiguation)]] * [[Gillette Mach3]], a manual razor with three blades * ''[[Mach 3]]'', a video game developed and published by Loriciels * Mach3, a [[Computer-aided manufacturing]] program by ArtSoft USA * [[Mach Loop]], a series of valleys in Wales * [[Mache (unit)]] * [[Mack (disambiguation)]] * [[Mac (disambiguation)]] * [[Mak (disambiguation)]] {{disambiguation|geo}}
